BASIRA 
What, so you have a back-up if John doesn’t make it? 
 
ELIAS 
I’m sure that won’t be necessary. 
 

The Magnus Archives – MAG116 – The Show Must Go On 
 
17 
 
MARTIN 
What? No! 
 
ARCHIVIST 
Martin, just... You can do more good here. 
 
MARTIN 
What, sat around drinking tea until the world ends? Or, you know, it doesn’t. 
 
BASIRA 
We hope. 
 
ARCHIVIST 
Melanie’s not coming either. I think... I think she’ll need you here. 
 
MARTIN 
Fine. 
 
ELIAS 
Glad that’s sorted. Now, unless there’s anything else? 
 
ARCHIVIST 
Not if, uh... No. 
 
ELIAS 
Excellent. Well, it’s a three hour trip up to Great Yarmouth. I had Rosie book 
you all into a bed and breakfast near the museum. 

The Magnus Archives – MAG116 – The Show Must Go On 
 
18 
 
 
ARCHIVIST 
Right. 
 
ELIAS 
Oh and, John, technically I can’t stop you, but I would heavily advise against 
bringing any... rogue elements. 
 
MARTIN 
You can just say Tim. 
 
ARCHIVIST 
I will take it under advisement. 
 
ELIAS 
Hmm. Anyway, don’t worry about staying in contact; I’ll know when it starts. 
 
ARCHIVIST 
Naturally. 
 
ELIAS 
That reminds me, make sure you keep any receipts for expenses. Assuming you 
wish to claim them back. 
 
ARCHIVIST 
And assuming we don’t... you know, die. 
 

The Magnus Archives – MAG116 – The Show Must Go On 
 
19 
 
ELIAS 
Yes. If you die, I’m afraid you probably won’t be able to claim your expenses. 
Now, if you’ll excuse me. 
 
(Elias leaves, closes door behind him) 
 
(Everyone exhales) 
 
BASIRA 
Do you think he bought it? 
 
MARTIN 
(Urgently) We’ll talk about it later. 
 
ARCHIVIST 
I doubt there’ll be time; we need to go. 
 
MARTIN 
It’s fine. We’ve got this. Ok? 
 
ARCHIVIST 
(Reluctant) Okay. 
 
DAISY 
Come on. 
 
BASIRA 

The Magnus Archives – MAG116 – The Show Must Go On 
 
20 
 
Yeah... Sure. 
 
(Click) 
 
(Click) 
 
TIM 
So? 
 
ARCHIVIST 
He doesn’t want you there. 
 
TIM 
And you? 
 
ARCHIVIST 
I... would rather have you where I can see you. 
 
TIM 
Good. 
 
ARCHIVIST 
You listen to the tape? 
 
TIM 
Yup, sounds like fun. 
 

The Magnus Archives – MAG116 – The Show Must Go On 
 
21 
 
ARCHIVIST 
Do I need to be worried about you? 
 
TIM 
You reading my mind again, boss? 
 
ARCHIVIST 
I’m watching your face. Do you— Are you going to keep it together? 
 
TIM 
Look, if you’re worried I’m going to go all Redrum and start hacking at random 
waxworks, don’t be. I’m not going to give us away. I want this to work. 
 
ARCHIVIST 
Thank you. 
 
TIM 
But I don’t think it will. So, I’m going to take that axe of yours and, when it all 
goes wrong, I’m going down swinging. And when I do, you’d better take the 
chance and stay out of my way. 
 
ARCHIVIST 
(Sighing) Okay, just... Okay. 
 
(Click) 
[The Magnus Archives Theme - Outro]
